page.title: 04KILNDOWN C.E. PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Kilndown School was built of sandstone from the Quarry opposite. It was opened by Louisa, Viscountess Beresford, on Saint Bartholomew's Day, 24th. August, 1846. It is now a Church of England Aided Primary School. There are now two classes, infants and juniors. The head teacher, Mr. Denton, also teaches the juniors. Mrs Batchelor teaches the infants, but is retiring at the end of this term. Mrs Doswell teaches part time, for one and a half days a week, with the juniors. The school has a computer with disc drive and we use another belonging to Mr. Denton. There are two classrooms, a hall, and a room for library, T.V. and computers. There are 32 children in the school. The six fourth years move on to Angley School next term.
